title: Install the game on my Windows PC
description: As a Windows PC gamer, I want to run a simple, guided installer for Monopoly Tycoon, so that I can get the game set up on my computer quickly and without errors, and start playing right away.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have downloaded the standalone installer executable for Monopoly Tycoon, when I run the installer and accept all default options, then the installer copies all game files to the default program files directory and a completion screen appears.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have started the installer on a machine where the target drive has less than the required 2 GB of free space, when I click the 'Install' button, then the installer must display a user-friendly error message stating that there is insufficient disk space.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have started the installer and am on any screen before the file copying process begins, when I click the 'Cancel' button and confirm, then the installer closes cleanly, leaving no partial files or directories on the system.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The Inno Setup script is peer-reviewed and merged. The installer is successfully built by the CI/CD pipeline as a single, signed executable. QA has confirmed the installed game launches and that the uninstaller is correctly created.

title: Choose a custom installation directory
description: As a Windows PC user installing the game, I want to be able to choose a custom installation directory so that I can manage my disk space and organize my installed applications according to my personal preferences.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is running the game installer and has reached the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user clicks the 'Browse...' button and selects a valid directory on a different drive (e.g., 'D:\Games'), then the installer successfully installs all game files into the 'D:\Games\MonopolyTycoon' directory.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user selects a directory on a drive where the available space is less than the required space, then the installer displays a clear error message stating 'Insufficient disk space' and the 'Next' button is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen where a default path is displayed, when the user does not change the directory and clicks 'Next', then the game is installed correctly into the default system-provided directory.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The Inno Setup script changes are peer-reviewed. Manual E2E testing confirms functionality on Windows 10 and 11. The final installer package is verified.

title: Provide an option to create a desktop shortcut during installation
description: As a new player installing the game, I want to see a checkbox option to create a desktop shortcut during the installation process, so that I can easily find and launch the game directly from my desktop after it's installed.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is running the game installer, when the user proceeds with the 'Create a desktop shortcut' option checked by default, then a shortcut named 'Monopoly Tycoon' is created on the user's desktop upon successful installation.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a desktop shortcut was created via the installer, when the user double-clicks the desktop shortcut, then the Monopoly Tycoon game application launches successfully.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is running the game installer, when the user unchecks the 'Create a desktop shortcut' option and completes the installation, then no shortcut for 'Monopoly Tycoon' is created on the user's desktop.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The Inno Setup script changes are peer-reviewed and merged. The shortcut's properties (icon, target) are verified. The final installer package is rebuilt and verified.

title: Ensure UI and Game View Adapt to Different Monitor Aspect Ratios
description: As a PC gamer with a monitor of any common aspect ratio, I want the game's user interface and 3D view to automatically adapt to my screen's dimensions so that I can play the game without any visual distortion, overlapping elements, or loss of critical information.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is launched in fullscreen mode on a display with a 16:9 aspect ratio (e.g., 1920x1080), when the user navigates to the main gameplay screen, then the game board is fully visible and centered, and all HUD elements are positioned correctly without overlapping.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the game is launched in fullscreen mode on a display with a 21:9 aspect ratio (e.g., 2560x1080), when the user views the main gameplay screen, then the game board maintains its correct proportions and is centered, and all HUD elements are anchored correctly to the screen edges.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game is running in windowed mode, when the user clicks and drags the window border to change its size and aspect ratio, then the UI layout and game view dynamically update to fit the new dimensions without crashing or producing rendering errors.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated on 16:9, 16:10, and 21:9 aspect ratios. All UI prefabs are configured with robust anchoring and scaling. Manual E2E testing confirms no visual regressions on supported resolutions. The feature is verified in a staging build.

title: Receive guidance on locating log files after an error
description: As a player who has encountered an unexpected game crash, I want to be shown a clear error message that includes a unique error ID and instructions on where to find the log files, so that I can easily provide developers with the necessary information to diagnose and fix the bug.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is running and an unhandled exception occurs, when the global exception handler catches the exception, then a modal error dialog is displayed, blocking interaction with the game window.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the error dialog is displayed, when the user views the dialog content, then the dialog contains a non-technical message, a unique Error ID, and the full, absolute path to the user's log directory.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an unhandled exception has been caught and an Error ID is displayed to the user, when the exception is processed by the logging system, then a log entry at the 'ERROR' level is written to the log file, containing the full exception details and the exact same Error ID shown in the dialog.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The global exception handler is implemented and catches exceptions from various parts of the application. The error dialog UI is reviewed for clarity. Manual testing confirms the end-to-end flow from crash to log file verification.

title: Uninstall the game cleanly from my computer
description: As a Windows PC user who no longer wishes to keep the game installed, I want a standard and thorough uninstallation process so that I can completely remove all application files and reclaim my disk space, ensuring my system remains clean.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is successfully installed on a Windows machine, when the user initiates the uninstallation process from 'Apps & features', then the uninstallation wizard is launched and removes all application files, shortcuts, and the 'Apps & features' entry upon completion.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Monopoly Tycoon game application is currently running, when the user attempts to launch the uninstaller, then the uninstaller displays a clear error message stating the game must be closed before proceeding and will not continue until the application is terminated.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is logged into a standard (non-administrator) Windows account, when the user initiates the uninstallation process, then a User Account Control (UAC) prompt appears, requesting administrator credentials to proceed.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The Inno Setup script changes for the uninstaller are peer-reviewed. Manual E2E testing on target Windows OS confirms clean removal of all application files and registry keys. The interaction with US-007 is verified.

title: Choose to keep my personal data upon uninstallation
description: As a Windows PC Gamer who needs to uninstall the game, I want to be given a clear choice to keep or delete my personal game data (like save files and player profile) so that I can reinstall the game later without losing all my progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is installed and the user has created personal data in the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory, when the user runs the uninstaller and selects 'No' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, then the application files are completely removed, but the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory and all its contents remain untouched.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the game is installed and the user has created personal data, when the user runs the uninstaller and selects 'Yes' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, then the application files AND the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory and all its contents are also deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game is installed but has never been run, so no '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory has been created, when the user runs the uninstaller, then the uninstallation process completes successfully without presenting a prompt to remove personal data.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The Inno Setup script is updated with the conditional logic. E2E testing confirms that data is correctly kept or deleted based on user choice. The user prompt is reviewed for clarity and defaults to the least destructive option.

title: Start a new game from the main menu
description: As a player, I want to select a 'New Game' option from the main menu so that I can proceed to the game setup screen and configure a new match.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player clicks the 'New Game' button, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen, and the main menu screen is no longer visible or interactive.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player uses keyboard navigation to focus on the 'New Game' button and presses the activation key, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player clicks the 'New Game' button multiple times in quick succession, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen only once, without errors or unexpected behavior.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The button is implemented on the main menu. The transition to the Game Setup screen is verified. Performance of the transition meets requirements. The feature is verified in a development build.

title: Configure a game with one to three AI opponents
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to select the number of AI opponents from a choice of one, two, or three, so that I can customize the game's challenge and duration to my preference.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I select '1' as the number of AI opponents and start the game, then a new game session is created with a total of two players: one human and one AI.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I select '3' as the number of AI opponents and start the game, then a new game session is created with a total of four players: one human and three AIs.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I change the selected number of AI opponents from '1' to '3', then the UI dynamically updates to display configuration sections for three distinct AI opponents.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The UI control for opponent selection is implemented. Integration testing confirms the selection correctly influences the number of players at game start. The UI dynamically updates as specified.

title: Set a unique difficulty level for each AI opponent
description: As a Human Player setting up a new game, I want to independently assign a difficulty level (Easy, Medium, or Hard) to each of my AI opponents so that I can customize the game's challenge to match my skill level and desired experience.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the Game Setup screen and have selected 3 AI opponents, when I set the difficulty for 'AI 1' to 'Easy', 'AI 2' to 'Hard', and 'AI 3' to 'Medium', then the UI must clearly display the selected difficulties for each AI respectively.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the Game Setup screen, when I increase the number of AI opponents from 1 to 2, then a new UI section for 'AI 2' appears, and its difficulty selector defaults to 'Medium'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have configured a game with two AI opponents set to 'Easy' and 'Hard', when I start the game, then the internal PlayerState objects for the two AIs must be initialized with 'ai_difficulty' properties of 'Easy' and 'Hard' respectively.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The UI for difficulty selection is implemented for each AI slot. Integration testing confirms that selected difficulties are correctly passed to the GameState on game start. The UI is verified to work as specified.

title: Create a player profile with a custom name
description: As a new or returning player, I want to create a personal profile by entering a custom name, so that my game progress, historical statistics, and high scores are saved and displayed under my unique identity.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen which contains a profile name input field, when the player enters a valid name (e.g., 'BoardwalkKing') and proceeds with game setup, then a new player profile is created and persisted with the entered name and a unique internal profile_id.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player enters a name with fewer than 3 characters and attempts to proceed, then a user-friendly validation message is displayed indicating the name is too short, and the game setup does not proceed.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has successfully created a profile with the name 'CashMoney', when the game starts, then the human player's name is displayed as 'CashMoney' in the main game HUD.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. Input validation logic is implemented. Integration with the SQLite database for persistence is complete and tested. The created profile name is correctly passed to the game session.

title: Receive feedback for an invalid profile name
description: As a player setting up my profile, I want to receive immediate and clear feedback if the name I enter is invalid, so that I can easily correct it and proceed to start the game without frustration.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen in the profile name input field, when the player enters a name with fewer than 3 characters (e.g., 'Al'), then a specific error message 'Name must be at least 3 characters long' is displayed, and the option to proceed is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the game setup screen in the profile name input field, when the player enters a name containing special characters (e.g., 'Player!@#'), then a specific error message 'Name can only contain letters and numbers' is displayed, and the option to proceed is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has entered an invalid name and an error message is currently displayed, when the player edits the name so that it meets all validation criteria, then the error message disappears, and the option to proceed becomes enabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. Real-time validation is implemented on the profile name input field. Error messages are specific and user-friendly. The 'Start Game' button state is correctly managed based on input validity.

title: View my persistent historical gameplay statistics
description: As a returning player, I want to access a dedicated screen that displays my cumulative gameplay statistics from all my completed games, so that I can track my performance and feel a sense of long-term progression.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has completed at least one game and has historical statistics saved, when the player selects the 'Player Statistics' option from the main menu, then a dedicated statistics screen is displayed showing all metrics as defined in REQ-1-034.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has created a profile but has not completed any games, when the player navigates to the 'Player Statistics' screen, then the screen displays all statistical categories with appropriate default values (e.g., 'Total Games Played: 0', 'Win/Loss Ratio: N/A').
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has existing statistics, including 'Total Games Played' = 5, when the player completes and wins a new game, then the 'Total Games Played' statistic displays '6' and the 'Total Wins' statistic is incremented.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The SQLite database schema for statistics is implemented. The data aggregation logic at game-end is functional. The UI screen correctly fetches and displays the data for both new and existing players.

title: Select my player token from a set of classic options
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to choose my game piece from a visual selection of classic tokens, so that I can personalize my in-game identity and feel more connected to the game experience.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player clicks on an available token (e.g., 'Top Hat') from the selection interface, then the 'Top Hat' token becomes visually highlighted and a preview is shown.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has selected a token and configured a game with 3 AI opponents, when the player starts the game, then the AI opponents are each assigned a unique token from the pool of tokens not selected by the human player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player selected the 'Battleship' token during game setup and started the game, when the main game view loads, then the player's 3D game piece on the board and their icon in the HUD is the 'Battleship'.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The token selection UI is implemented on the game setup screen. The logic for assigning unique tokens to AIs is functional. The selected token is correctly reflected in the game session.

title: Roll two six-sided dice to start my move
description: As a human player whose turn it is, I want to click a button to roll two virtual dice, so that I can determine the number of spaces my token will move and proceed with my turn.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the human player's turn and they are in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the player clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, then the system generates two random integer values between 1 and 6 inclusive, and a 3D dice roll animation is played.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given it is an AI player's turn or the human player has already rolled, when the game state is updated, then the 'Roll Dice' button is visually disabled and non-interactive.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, when the result of the two dice is identical values (e.g., 3 and 3), then the system correctly identifies the roll as doubles and sets a flag to grant an extra turn after the move is complete.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The cryptographically secure RNG is used. The logic for detecting doubles is implemented. The UI button is correctly enabled/disabled based on game state. A polished dice animation is integrated.

title: Watch my token automatically move around the board
description: As a player, I want to see my game token animate its movement from one space to the next after I roll the dice, so that I can visually track my progress around the board and have an immersive, intuitive gameplay experience.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player's token is on 'St. Charles Place' (index 11), when the player completes a dice roll with a total of 5, then the token animates moving sequentially across 5 spaces to land on 'Indiana Avenue' (index 16), and the camera smoothly follows the token.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has set the 'Game Speed' to 'Instant' in the settings menu, when the player's token needs to move, then the token instantly teleports to the destination space without a sequential movement animation.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player's turn results in them being sent to Jail, when the game logic directs the player to Jail, then a special, direct animation plays, moving the token from its current space directly to the 'In Jail' section of the board.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. A smooth, space-by-space token movement animation is implemented. The animation speed correctly respects the game speed setting. A special animation for 'Go to Jail' is implemented. The camera correctly follows the active token.

title: Receive an extra turn after rolling doubles
description: As a player (human or AI), I want to be granted an immediate, additional turn after I roll doubles, so that the game correctly follows the official Monopoly rules and provides an authentic gameplay experience.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is a player's turn and their consecutive doubles count is 0, when the player rolls doubles, then the player's token moves, the action is completed, the game state confirms it is still the same player's turn, and their consecutive doubles count is incremented to 1.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has just rolled doubles, when the player rolls again and the result is not a double, then the player moves, their consecutive doubles count is reset to 0, and the turn passes to the next player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state and chooses to roll the dice, when the player rolls doubles, then the player gets out of jail, moves, completes their action, and their turn ends; they are NOT granted an extra turn.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The turn management logic correctly grants an extra turn on a doubles roll. A per-turn doubles counter is implemented and correctly managed. The exception for getting out of jail is correctly implemented.

title: Be sent to jail for rolling three consecutive doubles
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically send my token to jail if I roll three consecutive doubles in a single turn, so that the game correctly enforces the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is taking their turn and has already rolled doubles twice in a row, when the player rolls the dice for a third time and the result is doubles, then the player's token is immediately moved directly to the 'In Jail' space and their turn ends.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has rolled doubles twice and is on a space near GO (e.g., Boardwalk), when the player rolls their third consecutive double, then the player's token is sent directly to Jail and does not collect the $200 GO salary.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has rolled doubles once or twice consecutively, when the player's next roll in the same turn is not doubles, then the player moves normally, their turn ends, and their consecutive doubles counter is reset to zero.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The logic to send a player to jail on the third consecutive double is implemented. The rule of not passing GO or collecting salary in this scenario is enforced. The consecutive doubles counter is correctly reset at the end of a turn sequence.

title: Collect $200 salary when passing or landing on GO
description: As a Player, I want my cash balance to be automatically credited with a $200 salary when my token passes over or lands on the GO space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player's token is on 'Boardwalk' (space 39) with a cash balance of $500, when the player rolls a 5, causing their token to move past GO, then the player's cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player's token is on 'Park Place' (space 37) with a cash balance of $500, when the player rolls a 3, causing their token to land exactly on 'GO', then the player's cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player draws a card that reads 'Go to Jail. Do not pass GO', when the card action is executed, then the player's token is moved directly to the 'In Jail' location and their cash balance remains unchanged.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The movement logic correctly detects when a player lands on or passes GO. The $200 salary is correctly credited to the player's cash. All 'Go to Jail' exceptions correctly bypass the salary collection.

title: Get out of jail by paying the $50 fine
description: As a player who is in jail, I want to be presented with the option to pay a $50 fine at the beginning of my turn, so that I can immediately get out of jail and continue my turn normally.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in the 'InJail' state and my cash balance is over $50, when the game presents the 'Get Out of Jail' options and I select 'Pay $50 Fine', then my cash balance is reduced by $50, my player status is updated to 'Active', and I proceed with a normal turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the 'InJail' state and my cash balance is $49, when the game presents the 'Get Out of Jail' options, then the 'Pay $50 Fine' option is visually disabled and non-interactive.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in the 'InJail' state and my cash balance is exactly $50, when I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, then my cash balance is reduced to $0, my player status is updated to 'Active', and I proceed with my turn.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The jail options UI correctly presents the payment option. The option is correctly enabled/disabled based on player cash. A successful payment correctly updates the player's state and allows the turn to proceed.

title: Get out of jail by using a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card
description: As a player who is in jail and owns a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, I want to be presented with the option to use it at the start of my turn, so that I can get out of jail immediately without spending money.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player's status is 'InJail', it is the start of their turn, and their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 1, when the player selects 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card', then the player's status is updated to 'Active', their card count becomes 0, and they proceed with a normal turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player uses a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card that originated from the Chance deck, when the action is confirmed, then the specific card is placed at the bottom of the Chance card deck.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player's status is 'InJail' and their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 0, when their turn begins, then the UI option to 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card' is not displayed or is disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The option to use a card is conditionally presented based on player inventory. Using a card correctly updates player state and returns the card to the correct deck. The player can proceed with a normal turn after using the card.

title: Attempt to get out of jail by rolling for doubles
description: As a player in jail, I want to choose the option to roll the dice on my turn, so that I can attempt to get out of jail for free by rolling doubles.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in Jail and it is my turn, when I select the 'Roll for Doubles' option and the result is doubles, then my player status is updated to 'Active' and my token moves forward the number of spaces shown on the dice, but I do not get an extra turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in Jail and it is my turn, when I select the 'Roll for Doubles' option and the result is not doubles, then my 'jail_turns_remaining' is decremented by 1 and my turn immediately ends.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the jail action menu is displayed with multiple options ('Roll for Doubles', 'Pay Fine'), when I click the 'Roll for Doubles' button, then all other options in the jail action menu become disabled and the dice roll sequence is initiated.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The logic for attempting to roll doubles is implemented. A successful roll correctly releases the player without granting an extra turn. A failed roll correctly ends the turn and decrements the jail turn counter.

title: Be forced to pay the fine after failing to roll doubles for 3 turns in jail
description: As a player in jail for my third consecutive turn, I want the game to automatically force me to pay the $50 fine if I fail to roll doubles, so that the official game rules are enforced and my turn can proceed.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state, their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1, and they have more than $50 cash, when the player rolls the dice and the result is not doubles, then the player's cash is reduced by $50, their status changes to 'Active', and their token moves the number of spaces shown on the dice.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state and their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1, when the player rolls the dice and the result is doubles, then the player's cash is not changed, their status changes to 'Active', and their token moves, but they do not get an extra turn.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state, their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1, and they have less than $50 cash, when the player rolls and the result is not doubles, then the game flow is paused and the player is prompted to raise funds to cover the $50 debt before movement occurs.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The logic for the third and final turn in jail is implemented. A failed roll correctly forces payment and subsequent movement. The interaction with the bankruptcy/asset liquidation system is tested and functional.

title: Draw a Chance card when landing on a Chance space
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Chance card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Chance space, so that the game follows the official rules and introduces an element of surprise.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player lands on a Chance space and the top card is 'Bank pays you dividend of $50', when the card is drawn, then a UI element displays the card, the player's cash becomes $50 richer, and the card is placed at the bottom of the Chance deck.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player lands on a Chance space and draws the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, when the card is drawn, then the card is displayed, the player's 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count becomes 1, and this specific card is removed from the deck cycle until used.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an AI player's token lands on a Chance space, when the card is drawn, then a non-intrusive UI notification briefly displays the card drawn by the AI, and the card's effect is automatically applied to the AI's PlayerState.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The Chance deck is correctly managed (shuffled, drawn, returned). All card effects are implemented as per the official rules. The special case for the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card is handled correctly. AI interactions are non-blocking for the human player.

title: Draw a Community Chest card when landing on a Community Chest space
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Community Chest card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Community Chest space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player lands on Community Chest and draws a card instructing them to collect money, when the card is drawn, then the player's cash balance and the HUD is increased by the specified amount.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player lands on Community Chest and draws the 'Go to Jail' card, when the card is drawn, then the player's token is moved directly to the 'In Jail' section of the board and their turn ends immediately.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player lands on Community Chest and draws a card instructing them to collect $10 from every player, when the card is drawn, then the active player's cash increases by $10 for each opponent, and each opponent's cash decreases by $10.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The Community Chest deck is correctly managed. All card effects, including multi-player transactions, are implemented as per the official rules. The interaction with other game systems like Jail and Bankruptcy is tested.

title: Choose to pay $200 or 10% of my net worth for Income Tax
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear choice between paying a flat $200 or 10% of my total net worth when I land on the Income Tax space, so that I can make the most strategic financial decision.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the human player's turn is active and their token lands on the 'Income Tax' space, when the movement phase concludes, then the game flow pauses and a modal dialog is displayed to the player with the two payment options.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has $500 cash and properties worth $1500 (Total Net Worth = $2000), when the Income Tax dialog is displayed, then the dialog must present two choices: one for a flat '$200' and another for '10% of Net Worth ($200)'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has $100 cash and a total net worth of $1500, when the player selects either the '$200' or '$150' option, then the game initiates the asset liquidation flow, requiring the player to mortgage properties or sell buildings to cover the chosen debt.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The net worth calculation is accurate. The modal dialog correctly presents the choice to the human player. The selected payment is correctly processed. The interaction with the bankruptcy system for insufficient funds is functional.

title: Pay a fixed Luxury Tax amount
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically deduct the fixed Luxury Tax amount from my cash when I land on that space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules and my turn can continue seamlessly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player has a cash balance greater than the Luxury Tax amount, when the player's token lands on the 'Luxury Tax' space, then the fixed tax amount is automatically deducted from the player's cash balance and a notification is displayed.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has a cash balance less than the Luxury Tax amount but owns assets, when the player's token lands on the 'Luxury Tax' space, then the game flow is paused, and the player is prompted to manage their assets to pay the debt.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has a cash balance less than the Luxury Tax amount and cannot raise sufficient funds, when the player's token lands on the 'Luxury Tax' space, then the player is declared bankrupt to the Bank.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The fixed tax amount is automatically deducted on the happy path. The system correctly initiates the asset liquidation or bankruptcy flow when the player has insufficient cash. The transaction is logged for auditability.

title: Experience no gameplay effect when landing on Free Parking
description: As a player, I want the game to apply no special action when my token lands on the Free Parking space so that the game adheres to the official Monopoly rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is in an active turn and has not rolled doubles, when the player's token lands on the 'Free Parking' space, then the player's cash balance remains unchanged, no action prompt is displayed, and the game proceeds to the next player's turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is in an active turn and rolls doubles, when the player's token lands on the 'Free Parking' space, then the player's cash balance remains unchanged and the game prompts the player to take their extra turn.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is on a space before GO (e.g., Boardwalk), when the player rolls a number that causes them to pass GO and land on 'Free Parking', then the player's cash balance first increases by $200 for passing GO, and the 'Free Parking' space itself has no further effect.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. Landing on Free Parking is correctly treated as a 'no-op' action. The turn correctly ends or continues (on doubles) after landing. The interaction with the 'Pass GO' mechanic is handled correctly.

title: Manage my properties before rolling the dice
description: As a strategic player, I want a dedicated phase at the start of my turn to manage my properties (build, mortgage, trade) before I roll the dice, so that I can proactively adjust my financial position.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the start of the human player's turn and the player is not in jail, when control is given to the human player, then the game enters a 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', the 'Roll Dice' button is enabled, and all property management UI controls are enabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the player successfully builds a house and then clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, then the house is added, cash is deducted, property management controls become disabled, and the game proceeds to the 'Roll Phase'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has just completed a turn where they rolled doubles, when the game grants the player an extra turn, then the game returns to the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', allowing the player to manage properties again before their next roll.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The game turn is correctly structured into phases. The player can perform management actions before rolling. The UI controls are correctly enabled/disabled based on the current turn phase. The 'doubles' and 'in jail' edge cases are handled correctly.

title: Choose to buy an unowned property I land on
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear prompt when I land on an unowned property, giving me the option to purchase it for its listed price, so that I can strategically acquire assets.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am the human player with $1000 in cash, when my token lands on the unowned property 'St. Charles Place' (price $140), then a modal dialog is displayed with 'Buy' and 'Auction' options, showing the property details.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the property purchase dialog is displayed and I click the 'Buy' button, when the transaction is processed, then my cash is reduced by $140, 'St. Charles Place' is added to my owned properties, and the board is visually updated.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am the human player with $100 in cash, when my token lands on 'St. Charles Place' (price $140), then the property purchase dialog is displayed, but the 'Buy' button is disabled and a message indicates insufficient funds.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The property purchase modal appears at the correct time. The 'Buy' option is correctly enabled/disabled based on player cash. A successful purchase updates the game state and visuals correctly.

title: Choose to send an unowned property to auction instead of buying it
description: As a Human Player, I want the option to decline the immediate purchase of an unowned property I land on so that I can trigger an auction for that property, allowing me to either acquire it for a lower price or force other players to spend their cash.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the purchase decision dialog for an unowned property is displayed, when I click the 'Auction' button, then the purchase decision dialog closes immediately and the auction process begins for that property.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have landed on an unowned property I cannot afford, when the purchase decision dialog is displayed, then the 'Buy' button is disabled, but the 'Auction' button remains enabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the purchase decision dialog is displayed on screen, when I attempt to click on any other UI element outside the dialog, then the interaction has no effect, and the dialog remains the focus until a decision is made.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The 'Auction' button is present on the purchase dialog. Clicking the button successfully initiates the auction sequence. The dialog is correctly modal and handles different player cash scenarios.

title: Participate in an auction for a property
description: As a Human Player, I want to participate in a turn-based auction for an unowned property, placing bids against AI opponents, so that I have a strategic opportunity to acquire properties that were not purchased outright.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an auction is in progress for 'Boardwalk' and it is the human player's turn to bid, when the human player places a valid winning bid and all other players withdraw, then the auction UI closes, the final bid amount is deducted from the player's cash, and the property is added to their portfolio.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an auction is in progress and it is the human player's turn to bid, when the human player selects the 'Withdraw' or 'Pass' option, then the human player is marked as inactive for this auction and the turn passes to the next active bidder.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an auction is in progress, the current high bid is $200, and the human player has $205 cash, when it is the player's turn and the minimum next bid is $206, then the 'Place Bid' button is disabled, leaving 'Withdraw' as the only available action.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The auction UI is functional and displays all required information. The clockwise bidding order is enforced. Bidding is correctly constrained by player cash. The winner is correctly determined and the transaction is processed.

title: Build houses on properties in a complete color set
description: As a player who owns a complete color set, I want to purchase and build houses on those properties so that I can increase the rent value and gain a strategic advantage.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own all properties in the Light Blue color set and have at least $50 cash, when I choose to build one house on Oriental Avenue, then my cash is reduced by $50, the bank's available house count decreases by one, and a visual representation of one house appears on the board.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own Oriental Avenue and Vermont Avenue, but not Connecticut Avenue, when I access the property management screen, then the option to build houses on my Light Blue properties is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own the complete Light Blue monopoly and have $49 cash, when I attempt to build a house (costing $50), then the build action fails with an 'Insufficient Funds' notification and my cash remains unchanged.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The logic correctly checks for monopoly ownership before allowing building. The transaction correctly updates player cash, bank inventory, and property state. The UI provides clear feedback for both successful and failed attempts.

title: Enforce even building rule for property development
description: As a player who owns a complete property set, I want the game to enforce the 'even building' rule when I try to purchase houses, so that the game is fair and follows official Monopoly rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a three-property monopoly where Property A has 1 house, and Properties B and C have 0 houses, when I attempt to build a second house on Property A, then the action is blocked, and the UI provides feedback explaining that I must build evenly.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly where every property has exactly one house, when I attempt to build a second house on any single property in that set, then the transaction is successful, and the selected property now has two houses.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a monopoly where Property A has 3 houses, and Properties B and C each have 2 houses, when I attempt to sell a house from Property B or C, then the action is blocked, and the UI indicates that I must sell from the property with the most houses first (Property A).
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The 'even building' rule is strictly enforced for both purchasing and selling houses. The UI provides clear, contextual feedback when an action is blocked by this rule. The logic correctly handles monopolies of different sizes.

title: Upgrade a set of 4 houses to a single hotel
description: As a strategic player who has developed a monopoly with four houses on each property, I want to purchase a hotel for each property, returning the four houses to the bank, so that I can charge the maximum possible rent.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a complete monopoly where every property has exactly 4 houses, have sufficient cash, and the Bank has hotels available, when I choose to 'Build Hotel' on a property, then my cash is reduced by the hotel's cost, the Bank's hotel count decreases by 1, the Bank's house count increases by 4, and the property's state is updated.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly where two properties have 4 houses, but a third property has only 3 houses, when I select any property within that monopoly, then the option to build a hotel is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am eligible to purchase a hotel but the Bank's supply of hotels is exhausted, when I attempt to purchase a hotel, then the transaction is blocked, and a UI notification clearly informs me of the hotel shortage.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The logic for upgrading to a hotel correctly enforces all prerequisites (4 houses on all properties in the set). The transaction correctly updates player cash and the bank's inventory of both houses and hotels. Error conditions like hotel shortages are handled gracefully.

title: Notify player of building shortage when attempting to build
description: As a player trying to develop my properties, I want to receive a clear, immediate notification when I am unable to build because the bank has run out of houses or hotels, so that I understand the game state.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the Property Management screen, when I attempt to purchase a house and the bank's supply of houses is 0, then the purchase action is prevented, and a non-modal notification appears with text like 'Cannot build: No houses available in the bank.'
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the bank's supply of houses is 0, when I view my properties in the Property Management interface, then the 'Build House' button(s) for all eligible properties are visually disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the bank's supply of houses was 0, when another player's action returns houses to the bank, then the 'Build House' buttons in my Property Management interface become enabled again on my turn.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The game correctly tracks the finite supply of houses and hotels. The UI provides clear, proactive feedback (disabled buttons) and reactive feedback (notifications) regarding building shortages. The UI state correctly updates when buildings become available again.

title: Participate in an auction for the last available buildings
description: As a strategic player, I want to participate in an auction for the last available houses or hotels when there's a building shortage, so that I have a fair, rule-compliant chance to acquire these critical assets.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the Bank has only 2 houses remaining and multiple players are eligible to build, when a player attempts to build, then the game identifies the shortage and initiates an auction for the 2 available houses, one at a time.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a building auction is active and it is the Human Player's turn to bid, when the auction UI is presented, then the UI must clearly display the item being auctioned ('1 House'), the current high bid, and allow the player to 'Bid' or 'Pass'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an auction is triggered for 2 remaining houses, when the first house is awarded to the winner, then a new, separate auction for the second house begins immediately, including all original eligible players.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The building shortage auction is correctly triggered. The auction UI is functional and provides all necessary information. Multiple buildings are auctioned sequentially. The system correctly identifies all eligible bidders for each auction.

title: Mortgage an undeveloped property to get cash
description: As a player managing my finances, I want to mortgage my undeveloped properties to the Bank, so that I can receive immediate cash to pay debts or fund purchases.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am the active player and own an undeveloped and unmortgaged property (e.g., 'Atlantic Avenue'), when I confirm the 'Mortgage' action, then my cash balance increases by the property's mortgage value ($130), its status becomes 'mortgaged', and the board visual is updated.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a property with one or more houses on it, when I open the Property Management interface, then the 'Mortgage' option is disabled with a tooltip explaining that all buildings on the property's color group must be sold first.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a mortgaged property, when an opponent's token lands on that property space, then no rent transaction occurs and my cash balance remains unchanged.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The mortgage transaction correctly updates player cash and property status. The rule preventing mortgaging of developed properties is enforced. The rule preventing rent collection on mortgaged properties is integrated and functional.

title: Unmortgage a property by paying the principal plus 10% interest
description: As a Human Player managing my assets, I want to pay the bank to unmortgage one of my properties so that I can start collecting rent on it again and enable future development.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own 'St. Charles Place' which is mortgaged (mortgage value $70), when I choose to unmortgage it and I have more than $77 cash, then exactly $77 ($70 principal + $7 interest) is deducted from my cash balance, and the property's status is updated to 'unmortgaged'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own 'St. Charles Place' which is mortgaged, when I attempt to unmortgage it for $77, but I only have $76 cash, then the 'Unmortgage' button is disabled in the UI and the transaction is blocked.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have successfully unmortgaged 'St. Charles Place', when I save the game, exit, and then load that save file, then the property is correctly loaded in its unmortgaged state.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The unmortgage cost is calculated correctly (principal + 10%). The transaction correctly updates player cash and property status. The UI correctly validates against player cash before enabling the action. The unmortgaged state persists correctly in save files.

title: Initiate a trade with an AI opponent during my turn
description: As a human player, I want to open a trading interface, select an AI opponent, and construct a trade offer involving cash and properties, so that I can strategically negotiate to complete monopolies.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the human player's turn, during the Pre-Roll Management Phase, when the player opens the trade interface, selects an AI opponent, constructs an offer, and clicks 'Propose Trade', then the trade proposal is submitted to the selected AI's decision-making module for evaluation.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the human player owns a property that has one or more houses on it, when the player opens the trade interface, then the developed property is not available for selection in the trade UI, with a tooltip explaining why.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the human player has $500 cash, when the player attempts to enter an amount greater than $500 in the cash offer field, then the UI prevents the input or caps the value at $500, and the 'Propose Trade' button is disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The trading interface can be opened at the correct time. The UI correctly enforces trading rules (no developed properties, cannot offer more cash than owned). A validly constructed trade is correctly passed to the AI for evaluation.

title: Respond to a trade offer from an AI opponent
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear dialog when an AI opponent proposes a trade, so that I can evaluate the deal and make an informed decision to either accept or decline it.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI opponent has initiated a trade proposal, when the system presents the offer to the human player, then the game flow is paused and a modal dialog is displayed showing the offered and requested items, along with 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, when the human player clicks the 'Accept' button, then the system validates the trade, exchanges the assets atomically, updates the game state, and the dialog closes.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, when the human player clicks the 'Decline' button, then the trade dialog closes immediately, no assets are exchanged, and the game flow resumes.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The AI trade proposal correctly triggers a modal dialog. The dialog clearly and accurately displays the terms of the trade. The 'Accept' and 'Decline' actions function correctly, with 'Accept' performing an atomic asset swap.

title: Propose a counter-offer to an AI's trade proposal
description: As a strategic player negotiating with an AI, I want to respond to their trade proposal with a modified counter-offer, so that I can fine-tune the deal to better suit my strategic goals.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI has proposed a trade, when the player clicks the 'Propose Counter-Offer' button, then the trade proposal dialog closes, and the main two-panel trading UI opens, pre-populated with the items from the original offer.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has opened the counter-offer UI and modified the trade, when the player submits the counter-offer, then the AI's evaluation logic is triggered and it responds with an acceptance or rejection, which is displayed in a notification.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has clicked 'Propose Counter-Offer' and the main trading UI is displayed, when the player clicks the 'Cancel' button, then the trading UI closes, the original trade offer is considered declined, and the game returns to its prior state.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The 'Propose Counter-Offer' button correctly transitions the user to the editable trade screen. The trade screen is correctly pre-populated. Submitting the counter-offer correctly triggers AI evaluation. The cancel flow is handled gracefully.

title: Receive a non-intrusive notification when AI players trade with each other
description: As a human player, I want to see a non-intrusive notification when a trade is completed between two AI opponents, so that I can maintain situational awareness of the game's strategic landscape.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress with a human player and at least two AI opponents, when AI 1 successfully completes a trade with AI 2, then a notification banner appears on the screen with a concise summary of the trade (e.g., 'Trade Complete: AI 1 traded Boardwalk to AI 2 for $500').
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a trade notification is displayed, when the notification appears, then the game flow is not interrupted or paused, and the notification disappears automatically after a few seconds.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a game is in progress, when AI 1 proposes a trade to AI 2 and AI 2 rejects the offer, then no trade notification is displayed to the human player.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. A notification is correctly triggered only upon successful AI-to-AI trades. The notification is non-intrusive, temporary, and provides a clear summary of the transaction. The feature works correctly on all game speed settings.

title: Automatically collect rent when an opponent lands on my property
description: As a property owner, I want the game to automatically calculate and transfer the correct rent from an opponent who lands on my property so that the game rules are enforced fairly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given Player A owns 'Baltic Avenue' (but not a monopoly) and it is not mortgaged, when Player B lands on 'Baltic Avenue', then the base rent for 'Baltic Avenue' ($4) is automatically deducted from Player B's cash and added to Player A's cash.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given Player A owns the monopoly for 'Boardwalk' and 'Park Place', and 'Boardwalk' has 3 houses, when Player B lands on 'Boardwalk', then the correct rent for 'Boardwalk' with 3 houses ($1400) is automatically transferred from Player B to Player A.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given Player A owns 'Indiana Avenue' and it is currently mortgaged, when Player B lands on 'Indiana Avenue', then no rent is collected, and no cash is transferred between players.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The rent calculation logic is accurate for all property types and states (standard, monopoly, developed, railroads, utilities, mortgaged). The transaction is processed automatically upon landing. The interaction with the bankruptcy system is triggered when a player cannot afford rent.

title: Automatically pay rent when I land on an opponent's property
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically calculate and process my rent payment when I land on an opponent's property, so that the game flows smoothly and the rules are enforced correctly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am a player with $1000 cash and land on an AI's property with a rent of $10, when my token's movement ends, then my cash is automatically reduced to $990, the AI opponent's cash increases by $10, and a notification confirms the payment.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am a player with $500 cash and land on an AI's undeveloped monopoly property where rent is doubled to $70, when my token's movement ends, then my cash is reduced to $430 and the AI's cash increases by $70.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am a player with $50 cash and no mortgagable assets, and I land on an opponent's property where the rent is $100, when the rent payment is triggered, then the system identifies I cannot pay the debt and initiates the bankruptcy process.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The system correctly triggers rent payment upon landing on an opponent's property. The amount is calculated correctly based on all game rules. The transaction is processed automatically. The bankruptcy flow is correctly initiated when funds are insufficient.

title: See a victory screen when I am the last player remaining
description: As a human player who has won the game, I want to be presented with a distinct and celebratory victory screen, so that my achievement is acknowledged and I feel a sense of accomplishment.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress with one human player and one final AI opponent, when the AI opponent is declared bankrupt, then the main game view is immediately replaced by a modal Victory Screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when the player views the screen, then the screen must display a prominent 'Victory!' message, the player's profile name, and key statistics like Final Net Worth and Game Duration.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when the screen first appears, then a victory fanfare audio clip plays and celebratory visual effects (e.g., confetti) are rendered.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The win condition is correctly detected. The UI transitions to a distinct victory screen. The screen displays accurate summary statistics and provides celebratory feedback. Navigation options to the main menu or full summary screen are functional.

title: See a game-over screen when I go bankrupt
description: As a human player, I want to be shown a clear 'Game Over' screen immediately after I am declared bankrupt, so that I understand I have lost the game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the human player incurs a debt they cannot pay after liquidating all assets, when the system declares the human player bankrupt, then the main game view is immediately replaced by a modal 'Game Over' screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the human player is viewing the 'Game Over' screen and more than one AI opponent remains, when the player clicks the 'View Game Summary' button, then a high-speed simulation of the remaining AI players' turns begins to determine the final winner.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the human player is in a game with only one AI opponent remaining, when the human player is declared bankrupt and clicks 'View Game Summary', then the game immediately transitions to the 'Game Summary' screen without a simulation.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The player loss condition is correctly detected. The game transitions to a distinct 'Game Over' screen. The high-speed AI simulation is correctly triggered when necessary. The flow to the final game summary screen is functional.

title: View a detailed game summary screen after a match ends
description: As a Human Player who has just completed a game, I want to be shown a detailed game summary screen so that I can review the performance of all players and understand the final outcome.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game has concluded (either by player win or loss), when the Game Summary screen is displayed, then it shows a 'Victory!' or 'Game Over' message, visually highlights the winner, and displays a statistics section for all players who participated.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Game Summary screen is displayed, when the user reviews the statistics for any player, then the values for 'Final Net Worth', 'Total Rent Collected', and 'Properties Owned' must accurately reflect the final state of the game.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Game Summary screen is being displayed, when the user clicks the 'Return to Main Menu' button, then the application navigates to the main menu screen.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The summary screen is displayed upon game completion. It accurately reflects the final game state and statistics for all players. The UI layout adapts to the number of players. Navigation back to the main menu is functional.

title: View at-a-glance information for all players in the HUD
description: As a player, I want a persistent on-screen display showing the name, token, and current cash for every player, so that I can instantly assess the financial standing of all participants.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a new 4-player game has been started, when the main game board scene is loaded, then a persistent HUD is visible with four panels, each correctly displaying a player's name, token icon, and starting cash of $1500.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a game is in progress and it is Player 1's turn, when the player views the game screen, then Player 1's panel in the HUD has a distinct visual highlight (e.g., a glowing border).
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player with $1000 cash pays $150 in rent, when the transaction is processed, then the player's cash display in the HUD immediately updates to show $850.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The HUD is implemented and displays all required information. The current turn indicator is clear and updates correctly. Player cash values update in real-time in response to game events. The HUD is responsive to different aspect ratios.

title: See clear visual indicators of property ownership on the board
description: As a player, I want clear, player-specific visual indicators on each property space on the board so that I can instantly understand who owns what and make faster strategic decisions.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a property on the board is unowned, when a player successfully purchases that property, then a visual indicator corresponding to the purchasing player's unique color immediately appears on the property space.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player owns a property and its standard ownership indicator is displayed, when the player mortgages that property, then the ownership indicator's visual state changes to clearly signify it is mortgaged (e.g., becomes greyed-out) while still identifying the owner.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given Player A owns Property X, when Player A and Player B complete a trade where Player B acquires Property X, then the marker on Property X immediately updates to show Player B's ownership.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. Property ownership changes (purchase, trade, bankruptcy) are immediately reflected by visual markers on the 3D board. The mortgaged state of a property is clearly and visually distinct. The markers are non-obtrusive and legible.

title: Interact with modal dialogs for critical decisions
description: As a human player, I want the game to pause and display a focused, interactive pop-up for critical decisions, so that I can consciously evaluate my options without the risk of missing important game events.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on an unowned property, when the game state updates, then the background processes are paused, a modal dialog is displayed showing the property details and presenting me with 'Buy' and 'Auction' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given any critical decision modal dialog is active on screen, when I attempt to click on any UI element outside of the modal dialog, then the clicks are ignored, and only interactions with the elements inside the modal dialog are registered.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given any critical decision modal dialog is active on screen, when I click one of the action buttons within the dialog, then the corresponding game logic is triggered, the modal dialog is closed, and the game state resumes its normal flow.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. A reusable modal dialog system is implemented. All critical player decisions (buy, trade response, tax choice) use this system. The game flow is correctly paused and resumed. The modals are exclusive and block background interaction.

title: Access a dedicated interface to manage all my properties
description: As a human player managing my in-game assets, I want to access a dedicated property management screen so that I can efficiently view the status of all my properties and take strategic actions like building or mortgaging from a single, consolidated interface.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the human player's turn, before they have rolled the dice, when the player clicks the 'Manage Properties' button, then a dedicated property management screen is displayed, listing all owned properties grouped by color set.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has a complete, undeveloped monopoly and sufficient cash, when the player selects a property from that monopoly and clicks the 'Build House' button, then the player's cash is debited and the property's state is updated.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player owns a monopoly where one property has 1 house and the others have 0, when the player selects the property that already has 1 house, then the 'Build House' button for that property is disabled with a tooltip explaining that building must be even.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. A dedicated property management screen is implemented. The screen allows for viewing, building, selling, mortgaging, and unmortgaging properties. The UI dynamically enables/disables actions based on game rules (monopoly ownership, even building, funds, etc.).

title: Use a two-panel interface to build and review trade offers
description: As a Human Player, I want a clear, two-panel trading interface that displays my items and the opponent's items side-by-side so that I can easily construct and review trade offers.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the trading interface is open, when the player adds one of their properties and enters a cash amount to the 'Your Offer' panel, and adds one of the AI's properties to the 'Their Offer' panel, then all selected items appear correctly in their respective panels.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the trading interface is open and the player owns a property with houses, when the player attempts to select the developed property to add to their offer, then the property is visually disabled in the selection list and cannot be added.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an AI opponent initiates a trade, when the offer is presented to the player, then the same two-panel interface appears, pre-populated with the AI's offer, and displays buttons for 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer'.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. A two-panel trading UI is implemented. The UI allows for the construction of complex offers involving properties, cash, and cards. The UI enforces all trading rules (no developed properties, sufficient funds). The same UI is used for player-initiated, AI-initiated, and counter-offers.

title: Access an in-game settings menu
description: As a player in the middle of a game, I want to access a settings menu without quitting the match, so that I can adjust game options, save my progress, or exit the game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress, when the player presses the 'Escape' key or clicks the 'Settings' icon, then the game simulation is paused and the settings menu is displayed as an overlay.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the in-game settings menu is open, when the player views the menu, then the menu must contain distinct, clickable options for 'Resume Game', 'Settings', 'Save Game', 'Load Game', and 'Return to Main Menu'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a modal dialog (e.g., a trade offer) is displayed to the player, when the player attempts to open the settings menu, then the settings menu does not open until the modal dialog is resolved.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The settings menu is accessible during gameplay and correctly pauses the game state. The menu contains all required navigation and action options. The menu's interaction with other modal UIs is handled correctly.

title: Adjust the game speed to make animations faster or instant
description: As an experienced player, I want to change the game speed setting so that I can reduce waiting times for animations and AI decisions, allowing for a faster-paced game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is in the settings menu, when the player selects the 'Fast' game speed option, then all subsequent game animations (e.g., dice rolls, token movement) play at an accelerated rate.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in the settings menu, when the player selects the 'Instant' game speed option, then all subsequent game animations are skipped or rendered almost instantaneously.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game speed is set to 'Fast' or 'Instant' and the human player is involved in a property auction, when the auction begins, then the game speed is automatically and temporarily set to 'Normal' for the duration of the auction.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The game speed setting is implemented with 'Normal', 'Fast', and 'Instant' options. The setting correctly modifies the duration of animations and AI delays. The auction override rule is correctly implemented. The setting is persisted in save files.

title: Adjust master
description: and sound effect volumes independently
story_points: As a player, I want to independently adjust the master, music, and sound effect volume levels so that I can customize the game's audio to my personal preference.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is in the settings menu, when the player moves the 'Music' volume slider, then the volume of the background music changes in real-time to match the slider's value, and the new setting is immediately persisted.
technical_tasks: Given the player is in the settings menu, when the player moves the 'Sound Effects' volume slider, then a sample sound effect is played at the new volume level, and the new setting is persisted.
definition_of_done: Given the player has set the Music volume to 30%, when the player closes the game completely and then relaunches it, then the game's music level is at 30% and the slider in the settings menu reflects this saved value.
column15: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. Three independent volume sliders (Master, Music, SFX) are implemented. The sliders provide real-time audio feedback. The settings are correctly persisted between game sessions and loaded on startup.

title: Reset all my historical statistics and high scores
description: As a Data-Conscious Player, I want an option in the settings menu to permanently delete all my historical gameplay statistics and high scores after a confirmation prompt, so that I can have a clean slate.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have existing historical statistics, when I click the 'Reset All Player Data' button and click 'Confirm' on the subsequent confirmation dialog, then all my historical statistics are reset to their default zero state in the database.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have existing historical statistics, when I click the 'Reset All Player Data' button and then click 'Cancel' on the confirmation dialog, then no data is modified or deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am a new user with no historical statistics recorded, when I navigate to the settings menu, then the 'Reset All Player Data' button is visibly disabled and cannot be clicked.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. A 'Reset' button is available in the settings menu. The action is protected by a confirmation dialog. The database operation correctly and completely removes all statistics and high score data for the current profile. The button is disabled when no data exists to be reset.

title: Provide a bulk deletion option for all saved games via the settings menu
description: As a user who wants to manage my game data, I want an option in the settings menu to delete all my saved games at once, with a confirmation step, so that I can easily clear out old progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user has at least one saved game file, when the user clicks the 'Delete All Saved Games' button AND clicks 'Confirm' on the confirmation dialog, then all files within the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon/saves' directory are permanently deleted.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user has at least one saved game file and has opened the deletion confirmation dialog, when the user clicks the 'Cancel' button, then the confirmation dialog closes and no files are deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user has no saved game files, when the user navigates to the settings menu, then the 'Delete All Saved Games' button is visibly disabled and cannot be clicked.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. A 'Delete Saves' button is implemented in the settings menu. The action is gated by a confirmation dialog. The operation correctly deletes all files from the designated save directory. The button is disabled when no saves exist.

title: Save game progress into one of several save slots
description: As a player, I want to save my current game progress into a specific save slot at the start of my turn, so that I can safely exit the game and resume playing from that point at a later time.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in an active game and it is the start of my turn, before I have rolled the dice, when I open the pause menu, select 'Save Game', and click on an 'Empty' save slot, then the complete current GameState object is serialized into a versioned JSON file.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the 'Save Game' menu and I click on a slot that contains a previously saved game, when a confirmation dialog appears and I select 'Yes', then the existing save file for that slot is replaced with the new game state data.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is an AI player's turn OR it is my turn but after I have rolled the dice, when I open the pause menu, then the 'Save Game' button is visually disabled and is not clickable.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The game state is fully serialized to a JSON file, including a version and checksum. The save functionality is correctly restricted to the player's pre-roll phase. Overwriting saves requires confirmation. The system gracefully handles file I/O errors.

title: Load a game from a previously saved slot
description: As a returning player, I want to select and load a previously saved game from the main menu, so that I can seamlessly continue my progress without having to start over.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the main menu and have at least one valid saved game, when I navigate to the 'Load Game' screen, select the valid save slot, and confirm, then the game transitions to the gameplay scene and the entire game state is perfectly restored.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen, when the list of save slots is displayed, then each occupied and valid slot must display metadata such as the player's profile name, the date of the save, and the turn number.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen and a save file has failed its checksum validation, when the list of save slots is displayed, then the slot for the corrupted file is marked as 'Corrupted' and is disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. The system can fully deserialize a valid save file and restore the game state. The load screen UI displays accurate metadata for each save. The system correctly identifies and handles corrupted or incompatible save files by disabling them in the UI.

title: Visually indicate unusable save files on the load game screen
