description: As a Returning Player, I want to see a clear, visual indication on the load game screen for any save files that are corrupted or incompatible, so that I can avoid the frustration of attempting to load a broken save.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a save file exists whose content does not match its stored checksum, when the player navigates to the 'Load Game' screen, then the entry for that save slot is visually distinct and clearly labeled as 'Corrupted'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a save slot is marked as 'Corrupted', when the player attempts to interact with it, then the 'Load' button for that slot is disabled, preventing any load attempt.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a valid save file exists that was created with an older, incompatible version of the game, when the player navigates to the 'Load Game' screen, then the entry for that save slot is visually distinct and clearly labeled as 'Incompatible Version'.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. Checksum validation is performed on all save files when the load screen is opened. Version compatibility is checked. Corrupted and incompatible files are clearly marked and made non-interactive. The application remains stable when presented with malformed files.

title: View a list of my top 10 victories
description: As a competitive player, I want to access a Top 10 High Score screen from the main menu, so that I can review my most successful victories and be motivated to beat my own records.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has won 10 or more games, when the player selects the 'Top Scores' option from the main menu, then a screen is displayed showing a list of exactly 10 entries, sorted by Final Net Worth in descending order.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has won 4 games, when the player navigates to the 'Top Scores' screen, then the list displays exactly 4 entries, sorted correctly.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the database contains two victory records with the exact same Final Net Worth, when the player views the 'Top Scores' screen, then the victory achieved in fewer turns is ranked higher.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. A new UI screen for high scores is implemented. The screen correctly queries, sorts (with primary and secondary keys), and displays the top 10 victories from the SQLite database. The UI correctly handles cases with fewer than 10 scores and no scores.

title: Export my top score history to a text file
description: As a competitive player, I want to export my Top 10 High Scores list to a simple, human-readable text file, so that I can easily share my achievements with friends or keep a personal record.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the 'Top Score History' screen with scores listed, when the player clicks the 'Export to Text' button and selects a location in the Windows 'Save As' dialog, then a '.txt' file is created at the specified location.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a high score file has been successfully exported, when the user opens the exported '.txt' file, then the file contains a clear header and each score entry is on a new line with all data fields (Rank, Name, Net Worth, etc.) clearly labeled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the high score list is empty, when the player views the 'Top Score History' screen, then the 'Export to Text' button is visibly disabled and not clickable.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. An 'Export' button is added to the high scores screen. The feature correctly uses the native Windows save dialog. The exported file is formatted for human readability and contains accurate data. The button is disabled when no scores exist.

title: Change the game's visual and audio theme
description: As a player, I want to select and apply different visual and audio themes for the game, so that I can customize my experience and keep the game feeling fresh.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the main menu, when the player navigates to Settings, selects a new theme (e.g., 'Futuristic'), and confirms, then the main menu's UI skin, background visuals, and music immediately change to the new theme's assets.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in an active game, when the player opens the pause menu, changes the theme, and resumes the game, then all in-game assets (game board, tokens, UI/HUD, music, SFX) are updated to the new theme.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has selected the 'Futuristic' theme and closed the application, when the player launches the game again, then the game starts up with the 'Futuristic' theme already active.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. An asset management system for dynamic theme swapping is implemented. At least two complete visual and audio themes are created and integrated. The theme selection persists across game sessions. The system handles missing theme assets gracefully.

title: Be notified of available game updates on startup
description: As a Game Player, I want to be notified when a new version of the game is available upon startup, so that I can easily access the latest features and bug fixes.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have an older version of the game installed and an active internet connection, when I launch the application, then the game performs an asynchronous version check and a non-intrusive notification is displayed on the main menu with a clickable link to the download page.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I do not have an active internet connection, when I launch the application, then the version check fails silently in the background, no error message is displayed, and the game loads to the main menu normally.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the application must not perform automatic updates, when the update notification is displayed, then clicking it only opens a web browser to the download page and does not download or install files automatically.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. An asynchronous, non-blocking version check is implemented on startup. A non-intrusive UI notification is displayed on the main menu when an update is available. The system fails gracefully and silently with no network connection. The application only notifies and links, it does not auto-update.

title: View the game's data privacy statement
description: As a privacy-conscious user, I want to access a clear data privacy statement from the main menu, so that I can understand what data the game collects and confirm that it operates entirely offline.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is on the main menu screen, when the user clicks the 'Privacy Policy' button, then a modal view appears displaying the game's data privacy statement.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the privacy statement view is open, when the user reads the content, then the text must explicitly confirm that the application operates entirely offline, all user data is stored locally, and no data is transmitted to any external server.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the privacy statement view is open and its text content exceeds the visible area, when the user attempts to scroll, then the text content scrolls smoothly, allowing the entire statement to be read.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria are met and validated. A 'Privacy Policy' button is added to the main menu. The view displays the full, accurate text sourced from an external resource file. The view is scrollable and can be closed to return to the main menu.
